TopicTitle: So... Just downloaded Orbiter 2010 last night

Articles.Content: I was playing Orbiter and it seems like a really cool game. I went through the tutorial first so I may start trying my first mission tonight. Is it a considerably difficult game if you want to get to Mars (My goal)?

Being a sim, it\'s very difficult to get anywhere in Orbiter :b

But don\'t take that as a turn-off, the challenge is part of the fun. Infact, tonight I\'m going to make yet another Lunar Orbit mission attempt.

BTW, if you have any questions, the forums are a great place to present them

Being a sim, it\'s very difficult to get anywhere in Orbiter :b

But don\'t take that as a turn-off, the challenge is part of the fun. Infact, tonight I\'m going to make yet another Lunar Orbit mission attempt.

BTW, if you have any questions, the forums are a great place to present them

Sure. I\'d like to orbit the moon tonight and successfully return. My next mission will be to make a free return around Mars.
A martian free-return is going to be tricky. Even more so than orbital insertion, probably.

A martian free-return is going to be tricky. Even more so than orbital insertion, probably.

Hey Silisko!

I\'m like, your BIGGEST fan.

*blushes*

Back on topic, I\'m interested now. I might have to try this 'Orbiter'
I\'m also going to try.

Just played it a little bit. I really prefer Kerbal. Orbiter is very boring and slow and there\'s not much piloting in it, to be honest. What I noticed about orbiter is you click on one of the steps in the AMSO Apollo add-on and then the computer practically does everything for you... The only piloting and trajectory planning you do is just typing in numbers and clicking on things in the MFD. It doesn\'t even seem realistic...

I wouldn\'t rate the game very high. I\'ve just started KSP back up again.

Let\'s just hope this never happens:

Just imagine:

'So you can\'t build the rockets in this game?'

'No, only pilot them.'

'Where\'s the navball?'

'There isn\'t one.'

'Where are my astronauts!?'

I have it, I positively suck at it...

...

...

...

...

badly.

It doesn\'t even seem realistic...

I wouldn\'t rate the game very high. I\'ve just started KSP back up again.

:

BTW: Stop making pointless, stupid threads. If you want to tell everyone absolutely everything so much, get twitter and a facebook, or whatever.

:

It\'s true. To me it just seemed like clicking some buttons and typing letters and numbers in. There wasn\'t much real piloting. While most of spaceflight is automatic, in the Apollo days, you still had to do a lot of navigating by the stars through a sextant manually. You also have to perform your own fine piloting etc.
uhh, what?
You can disable the computer and do it yourself, you realize...

> I broke up on re-entering the atmosphere

> I can\'t even get to the moon

> I am horrible at orbiter

Try to learn Orbiter is not easy and you learn it not in a day. You will think: I wanna stop with this. But don\'t do that, learning Orbiter takes some weeks (or even months) and its hard. But if you have learn it, then a Interplanetary travel is not hard to do.

So don\'t worry about a failure, you can always restart it from the begin

It doesn\'t even seem realistic...

If KSP is Ã¼ber realistic.....
Remember, Orbiter is a sim, not a game. Don\'t even try to compare it with KSP.

:

BTW: Stop making pointless, stupid threads. If you want to tell everyone absolutely everything so much, get twitter and a facebook, or whatever.

Really? So posting about how I downloaded orbiter in the OFF TOPIC THREAD... Seriously, if you\'re going to just complain about how pointless all the threads are, STOP LOOKING AT THEM.

Really? So posting about how I downloaded orbiter in the OFF TOPIC THREAD... Seriously, if you\'re going to just complain about how pointless all the threads are, STOP LOOKING AT THEM.

It\'s tough to miss them when there are 5 on a page. And tone down the anger a little. You\'ve been posting quite a bit in the general discussion. The topics are over screenshots you made. So yeah, I\'m pretty sure some forum members are a little ticked off that they have to sift through your screenshot threads to find a real one.
One of those has not been posted in quite some time.
